hackathon-description-text: Welcome to Hack Western! From November 27th to 29th, 450 students across Canada and the U.S. from diverse backgrounds will come to Western University to create interdisciplinary solutions to real world problems. Hack Western provides a welcoming atmosphere for students to create a web, mobile, or hardware hack. Teams can work on their hacks from 11:30pm on Friday to 10am on Sunday. All projects must be submitted here on Devpost by November 29th at 10am.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Co-Founder & CEO at Big Viking Games

hackathon-eligibility: Any student who has been accepted to participate and hacked at Hack Western is eligible to submit a project.
hackathon-rules:
The Hack Western organizing team reserves the right to disqualify project submissions that do not adhere to the following guidelines. Please contact a Hack Western Organizer if you have any questions regarding these guidelines.

Projects can be completed individually or in a group with a maximum size of 4 students. All team members must be approved, registered Hack Western attendees present at the event.

All code written for Hack Western must be written between 11:30PM on Friday, November 27, 2015 and 10:00AM on Sunday, November 29, 2015 with the exception of code taken from public and open source libraries, APIs, or tutorials.

All hardware assembled for Hack Western must be assembled between 11:30PM on Friday November 27th and 10:00AM on Sunday November 29th, with the exception of manufactured parts that do not require soldering or assembly with a breadboard outside of the factory (such as robotic arms, Myos, or 3D printed parts).

All art assets brought into Hack Western for your project must be free and publicly available.

Students are free to bring codeless wireframes for the layout of their projects. Hardware may be prototyped in advance to optimize the shape and size of parts, but the actual project presented for submission must be assembled at Hack Western.

The final product must be original: it must not be the same as the product of a tutorial, a submission to a previous hackathon, or a personal project completed before Hack Western. Attendees are trusted to ensure the originality of their projects in good faith. Hack Western retains the right to inspect the source code of projects in case of dispute. All projects and intellectual property produced at Hack Western belong to the attendees who produced it.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Presented by MLH: Each member of the team will receive a Dell Venue 10 Tablet.
Presented by GDLS: Each member of the team will receive a Samsung Galaxy Tab 4.
Presented by Startech: Each member of the team will receive a laptop dock and a prize of their choice valued at $100.
Each member of the team will receive a prize of their choice valued at $100.
Presented by Green Brick Labs: Each member of the team will be awarded a USB with Armoury Wallets loaded with $100 bitcoin.
Presented by Info-Tech: Each member of the team will receive a Nabu Smart Band.
Presented by Digital Boundary Group: Each member of the team will be awarded a DBG branded sweater, a laptop bag, and a $100 Best Buy gift card.
Presented by Namecheap: $150 Namecheap credits for the best domain name.
Presented by GLDS: Each member of the team will receive a Samsung Galaxy Tab 4.
Presented by Big Viking Games: Each member of the team will be awarded a Razer mechanical keyboard and mouse.
Presented by Magnet Forensics: Each member of the team will be awarded Sony MDR-10 Bluetooth headphones.
Presented by Particle: Each member of the team will be awarded a maker kit and t-shirt.
Presented by Tech Alliance: Each member of the team will be awarded Apple TV.
Presented by Estimote: Each member of the team will receive an Estimote Developer Kit.
Presented by Wolfram: $300 cash prize for the team with the best Wolfram project.
Presented by Major League Hacking: Each member of the team will be awarded a Dell 1TB hard drive.
Presented by BITalino: Each member of the team will be awarded a BITalino kit.
Presented by Domain.com: Each member of the team will receive a Domain.com swag bag.
Presented by Engine SevenFour: Each member of the team will receive a drone.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Use of Open Source Technology
